main event: Two flying lights were observed about 1/2 mile away, moving in a northeasterly direction. They landed in a field and one light became a stationary object, while the other appeared to be a blue-white color. Later, a whirring sound was heard and a column of bluish light appeared at the window and remained for about 4 minutes.
interesting points: The two objects were moving in a northeasterly direction before landing in a field.
One object became a stationary object, while the other appeared to be a blue-white color.
Later, a whirring sound was heard and a column of bluish light appeared at the window and remained for about 4 minutes.
The sighting was reported to authorities and investigated by Project Blue Book.
The witness had previously seen similar objects in the southwest part of Dallas, Texas in the early part of 1957.
sighted object: two flying lights, one stationary object, and a column of bluish light
location: approximately 16 miles south of Mason, Texas
witnesses: two observers on a deer stand
